##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)

The root cause is straightforward: the parser takes too much time when parsing long SQL first time. Execute the SQL again will not cost time. 
BTW, what's the time cost if execute this SQL directly from MySQL server?

> The root cause is straightforward: the parser takes too much time when parsing long SQL first time. Execute the SQL again will not cost time.
> BTW, what's the time cost if execute this SQL directly from MySQL server?

I am using the default data source, he should not be parsed by SQL。If it is directly executed by the MySQL server, it only takes less than 100 milliseconds.

I know the way you said, but this one is in the same transaction with the sharing table - two data sources can't control the transaction

Since the SnowflakeShardingKeyGenerator has a left shift operation when generating a number at different timestamps, the remainder is always 0 or 1 when this number is used to modulate a number of 2^n(your number is 4).

Ok. It looks the same as the documentation.
Do you use the 4.0.0-RC2 version?

If the problem persists after reading the documentation, could you provide a sample project to github?

> > ink this is due to your shardi
> 
> Thanks for your reply. How can I config to make Shardingsphere send only 3 query requests? The data locates in three certain tables, it's useless to send extra 6 query requests to DB which does not contain data. BTW, I shard my data into 100 DBs * 10 Tables, it costs serious problem in my situation

Welcome to discuss, [https://blog.csdn.net/D_19901719576/article/details/102925945]( https://blog.csdn.net/D_19901719576/article/details/102925945)

> Hi @ygycomon , i think this is due to your sharding rules.
> 
> ```
> orderTableRuleConfig.setDatabaseShardingStrategyConfig(new InlineShardingStrategyConfiguration("user_id", "ds${user_id % 3}"));
> orderTableRuleConfig.setTableShardingStrategyConfig(new InlineShardingStrategyConfiguration("user_id", "test_${user_id % 10}"));
> ```
> 
> `user_id in (1, 2, 3)` will route to 3 databases and 3 tables, so it is 9 query requests.

Welcome to discuss, https://blog.csdn.net/D_19901719576/article/details/102925945
@maybeclold  the mysql driver too higher.. try 5.X or 6.X
i want try do it...

but if i remove the tpye isok 
like #{ruleResult}

Hi, @Joe192168 

**For English only**, other languages will not accept.

This issue will be closed, You can submit a new issue in English again.
They are diffenent version.    Please use the new version with `org.apache` package name.
But the org.apache package is not compatible with com.dangdang's package？

Pagination queries  is Supported,  there is almost no difference from a single data source when using multiple data sources. 
Please read:
https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/features/sharding/use-norms/pagination/
or in Chinese:
https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/cn/features/sharding/use-norms/pagination/
One Notice: ORDER BY is required for Pagination queries.

Yes, they are not compatible,  That  `com.dangdang`  is a very old version.
The new version fixes a lot of issues and provides new features,  you can try.

Got it. It worked after config my datasource url with 'tinyInt1isBit=false'. In addition, When 4.0.0-RC3 can be found in maven central repository?

> 1、All database's catalog equal database name
> 2、oracle's schema equal username ,but other database's schema equal null.

The 'sharding-orchestration-instance' module is not necessary, as I put implementation classes in the sharding-orchestration-center module. And are you still interested in this? Nacos implementation class is still need someone to write in sharding-orchestration-center module.

DISCUSS:

 Writing the description and constraint of configuring the max vibration offset in the official document.

1. explanation
      Using the snowflake algorithm as the partition key strategy, the max vibration offset needs to be configured.

2. Constraints
      The max vibration offset is not recommended to take the number not 2 ^ n but less than 2 ^ 12
When the number of physical tables is 2 ^ n, the max vibration offset needs to be configured as 2 ^ n-1

Any Suggestions?

> Is your USER_ID `null`?

it's not null.
if you use "@Column(name = "USER_ID", nullable = false)",  then 'MY_FRIEND_$->{USER_ID % 10}' or 'MY_FRIEND_$->{user_id % 10}' all error.
if you use "@Column(name = "user_id", nullable = false)", then 'MY_FRIEND_$->{USER_ID % 10}' is error, but 'MY_FRIEND_$->{user_id % 10}' is ok.
if you use 'precise-algorithm-class-name', all is ok.
The reason for the submission is lack of uniformity,'@Column' and 'inline expression'.
Update:  I am still debugging this issue, try to find the best solution.

Check conflict is not ShardingSphere's scope, maven can help user to do it better.
So I want discuss about that do we really need this feature?
